div.pre: 318 Hierapytna (mod. Hierapetra) ?, Crete, (434) 1935 ? Burial: 2nd cent. or later (see note) Contents: 12+ AR. Perseus: 1 dr. Cydonia: 1 triob. Gortyna: 1 dr. Cyrene: didr. Disposition: London 3 (Perseus and Cretan coins) Note from E. S. G. Robinson, no further details It seems possible that this small lot represents fragments of two separate hds.: the Cyrene didr. from Crete 1936 (no. 154 above) and the London coins from Hierapytna 1933 ?
